conclusion: Understanding electromagnetic induction and calculation of induced emf when a conductor moves in a magnetic field.
A straight metal rod moving perpendicular to a uniform magnetic field.
The rod moves with a velocity v perpendicular to both the rod and the magnetic field.
The induced emf (ε) is given by ε = B * L * v.
The rod is bent into two equal-length segments that are mutually perpendicular.
Each segment has a length of L/2.
The bent rod moves in the direction of the angle bisector of the included angle between the two segments.
The velocity vector v is now at an angle of 45 degrees to each segment.
The component of velocity perpendicular to each segment is v * cos(45 degrees) = v/sqrt(2).
The induced emf in each segment is ε_segment = B * (L/2) * (v/sqrt(2)).
The total induced emf (ε') in the bent rod is ε' = 2 * ε_segment = B * L * (v/sqrt(2)).
The ratio of the induced emfs is ε'/ε = (B * L * (v/sqrt(2))) / (B * L * v) = 1/sqrt(2).
